API reference¶

Experiment class¶

class packerlabimaging.Experiment(date: str, comments: str, dataPath: str, analysisSavePath: str, microscope: str, expID: str, TrialsInformation: MutableMapping[str, packerlabimaging.utils.classes.TrialsInformation], useSuite2p: bool = False, s2pResultsPath: Optional[str] = None)[source]¶

A class to initialize and store data of an imaging experiment. This class acts as a bucket to contain information about individual trial objects.

update_suite2p(trialID: Optional[str] = None, s2pResultsPath: Optional[str] = None)[source]¶

Add trial to suite2p trial list, and/or update an existing instance of the Suite2p submodule in Experiment.

Parameters

  • trialID – trial name to add to suite2p list

  • s2pResultsPath – path to output of suite2p to use to update .Suite2p submodule

add_trial(trial_id: str, total_frames_stitched: int, trials_information: Optional[packerlabimaging.utils.classes.TrialsInformation] = None)[source]¶

Create and add trial object to the experiment. Return trial object.

Parameters

  • trial_id –

  • total_frames_stitched –

  • trials_information –

Returns

trial object

property tiff_path_dir¶

retrieve the parent directory of the provided tiff_path

property pkl_path¶

path in Analysis folder to save pkl object

save_pkl(pkl_path: Optional[str] = None)[source]¶

saves packerlabimaging Experiment object using Pickle library (.pkl file extension).

Parameters

pkl_path – full .pkl s2pResultsPath for saving the Experiment object.

load_trial(trialID: str)[source]¶

method for importing individual trial objects from Experiment instance using the trial id for a given trial

__init__(date: str, comments: str, dataPath: str, analysisSavePath: str, microscope: str, expID: str, TrialsInformation: MutableMapping[str, packerlabimaging.utils.classes.TrialsInformation], useSuite2p: bool = False, s2pResultsPath: Optional[str] = None) → None¶

TwoPhotonImagingTrial class¶

class packerlabimaging.TwoPhotonImagingTrial(metainfo: dict, analysis_save_path: str, microscope: str = 'Bruker', paq_options: Optional[dict] = None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Two Photon Imaging Experiment Data Analysis Workflow.

__init__(metainfo: dict, analysis_save_path: str, microscope: str = 'Bruker', paq_options: Optional[dict] = None, **kwargs)[source]¶

TODO update function docstring for approp args :param metainfo: TypedDict containing meta-information field needed for this experiment. Please see TwoPhotonImagingMetainfo for type hints on accepted keys. :param paq_options: TypedDict containing meta-information about .paq file associated with current trial :param analysis_save_path: path of where to save the experiment analysis object :param microscope: name of microscope used to record imaging (options: “Bruker” (default), “other”) :param imagingMicroscopeMetadata: provide ImagingMetadata object (see ImagingMetadata class). :param suite2p_experiment_obj: provide Suite2p Experiment Object as variable in order to process Suite2p data for current trial :param total_frames_stitched: provide frame number on which current trial starts in Suite2p Experiment Object

tiff_path¶

path to the tiff for current trial

save_dir¶

path to the directory to save outputs from analysis

imparams¶

Imaging Microscope Metadata submodule for trial

Paq¶

Paq data submodule for trial

meanFluImg¶

mean image and mean FOV fluorescence trace

meanFovFluTrace¶

mean image and mean FOV fluorescence trace

Suite2p¶

Suite2p results submodule for trial

dFF¶

dFF normalized Suite2p data for trial

data¶

anndata storage submodule

property fig_save_path¶

create path for saving figures

property date¶

date of the experiment datacollection

property expID¶

experiment ID of current trial object

property trialID¶

trial ID of current trial object

property pkl_path¶

path in Analysis folder to save pkl object

create_anndata()[source]¶

Creates annotated data (see anndata library for more information on AnnotatedData) object based around the Ca2+ matrix of the imaging trial.

dfof()[source]¶

(delta F)/F normalization of raw Suite2p data of trial.

importTrialTiff() → numpy.ndarray[source]¶

Import current trial’s microscope imaging tiff in full.

Returns

imaging tiff as numpy array

meanRawFluTrace()[source]¶

Collects the raw mean of FOV fluorescence trace across the t-series.

Returns

mean fluorescence trace

makeDownsampledTiff()[source]¶

Import current trial tiff, create downsampled tiff and save in default analysis directory.

plotSingleImageFrame(frame_num: int = 0, title: Optional[str] = None)[source]¶

plots an image of a single specified tiff frame after reading using tifffile. :param frame_num: frame # from 2p imaging tiff to show (default is 0 - i.e. the first frame) :param title: (optional) give a string to use as title :return: matplotlib imshow plot

save_pkl(pkl_path: Optional[str] = None)[source]¶

Alias method for saving current object to pickle file.

Parameters

pkl_path – (optional) provide path to save object to pickle file.

save()[source]¶

Alias method for saving current object as pickle file.

AllOpticalTrial class¶

class packerlabimaging.AllOpticalTrial(metainfo: packerlabimaging.TwoPhotonImagingMain.TwoPhotonImagingMetainfo, naparm_path: str, analysis_save_path: str, microscope: str, paq_options: Optional[packerlabimaging.utils.classes.PaqInfoTrial] = None, prestim_sec: float = 1.0, poststim_sec: float = 3.0, pre_stim_response_window: float = 0.5, post_stim_response_window: float = 0.5, **kwargs)[source]¶

All Optical Experimental Data Analysis Workflow.

__init__(metainfo: packerlabimaging.TwoPhotonImagingMain.TwoPhotonImagingMetainfo, naparm_path: str, analysis_save_path: str, microscope: str, paq_options: Optional[packerlabimaging.utils.classes.PaqInfoTrial] = None, prestim_sec: float = 1.0, poststim_sec: float = 3.0, pre_stim_response_window: float = 0.5, post_stim_response_window: float = 0.5, **kwargs)[source]¶
Parameters

  • metainfo – TypedDict containing meta-information field needed for this experiment. Please see TwoPhotonImagingMetainfo for type hints on accepted keys.

  • paq_options – TypedDict containing meta-information about .paq file associated with current trial

  • naparm_path – path to folder containing photostimulation setup built by NAPARM

  • analysis_save_path – path of where to save the experiment analysis object

  • microscope – name of microscope used to record imaging (options: “Bruker” (default), “other”)

  • prestim_sec – pre-photostimulation timeperiod for collecting photostimulation timed signals

  • poststim_sec – post-photostimulation timeperiod for collecting photostimulation timed signals

  • pre_stim_response_window – pre-photostimulation time window for measurement of photostimulation evoked responses

  • post_stim_response_window – post-photostimulation time window for measurement of photostimulation evoked responses

property naparm_path¶

setting location of naparm files that specify the photostimulation experiment setup

property pre_stim_response_frames_window¶

num frames for measuring Flu trace before each photostimulation trial during photostim response measurement (units: frames)

property pre_stim_frames¶

num frames for collecting Flu trace after each photostimulation trial (units: frames)

property post_stim_frames¶

num frames for collecting Flu trace after each photostimulation trial (units: frames)

property post_stim_response_frames_window¶

num frames for collecting Flu trace after each photostimulation trial (units: frames)

property timeVector¶

vector of frame times in milliseconds rather than frames

get_alltargets_stim_traces_norm(process: str, targets_idx: Optional[int] = None, subselect_cells: Optional[list] = None, pre_stim=15, post_stim=200, stims: Optional[list] = None)[source]¶

primary function to measure the dFF and dF/setdF trace SNIPPETS for photostimulated targets.

Parameters

  • stims –

  • targets_idx – integer for the index of target cell to process

  • subselect_cells – ls of cells to subset from the overall set of traces (use in place of targets_idx if desired)

  • pre_stim – number of frames to use as pre-stim

  • post_stim – number of frames to use as post-stim

  • filter_sz – whether to filter out stims that are occuring seizures

Returns

lists of individual targets dFF traces, and averaged targets dFF over all stims for each target

get_SLMTarget_responses_dff(process: str, threshold=10, stims_to_use: Optional[list] = None)[source]¶

calculations of dFF responses to photostimulation of SLM Targets. Includes calculating reliability of slm targets, saving success stim locations, and saving stim response magnitudes as pandas dataframe.

Parameters

  • threshold – dFF threshold above which a response for a photostim trial is considered a success.

  • stims_to_use – ls of stims to retrieve photostim trial dFF responses

Returns

calculate_SLMTarget_SuccessStims(hits_df, process: str, stims_idx_l: list, exclude_stims_targets: dict = {})[source]¶

uses outputs of calculate_SLMTarget_responses_dff to calculate overall successrate of the specified stims

Parameters

  • hits_df – pandas dataframe of targets x stims where 1 denotes successful stim response (0 is failure)

  • stims_idx_l – ls of stims to use for this function (useful when needing to filter out certain stims for in/out of sz)

  • exclude_stims_targets – dictionary of stims (keys) where the values for each stim contains the targets that should be excluded from counting in the analysis of Success/failure of trial

:return

reliability_slmtargets: dict; reliability (% of successful stims) for each SLM target traces_SLMtargets_successes_avg: np.array; photostims avg traces for each SLM target (successful stims only)

photostimProcessingAllCells(plane: int = 0)[source]¶

Take dfof trace for entire timeseries and break it up in to individual trials, calculate the mean amplitudes of response and statistical significance across all trials

Inputs:

plane - imaging plane n
